bit_field.name: BOOT_SRC
bit_field.description: Primary boot source

bit_field_value.name: SECONDARY_BOOTLOADER_0b10
bit_field_value.description: Secondary Boot loader in Bank1 IFR0 (32KB)

bit_field.name: ISP_BOOT_IF
bit_field.description: ISP boot interface

bit_field.name: REC_BOOT_SRC
bit_field.description: Recovery boot source

bit_field_value.name: SB3_IMAGE
bit_field_value.description: SB3 image in 1-bit SPI flash connected to FlexComm. FC7 used for this function by default overlaps with FlexSPI A.

bit_field.name: BOOT_SPEED
bit_field.description: Core Clock

bit_field.name: HEADER
bit_field.description: CMPA Header marker should be set to 0x5963. After this header is set, all non-zero values will take effect; leaving all settings at 0xff will cause undefined behavior. It is recommended to set all values to 0x00 before setting the CMPA header value.

bit_field.name: FLASH_REMAP_SIZE
bit_field.description:
Flash remap size. 
FLASH_REMAP_SIZE defines the size of the secondary boot image 
(the range of flash addresses that will be remapped)in internal flash, where remapped 
address end = (FLASH_REMAP_SIZE + 1) * 32 KB. For example, if FLASH_REMAP_SIZE = 2, 
then the first 96KB of addresses will be remapped to flash bank1 instead of flash bank0 
when remap is active. Set this field to 0 if you do not want to use the flash remap feature.

bit_field.name: OEM_BANK1_IFR0_PROT
bit_field.description:
Defines protection for Bank1_IFR0 area based on usage. 
Note, if the SBL / Recovery image size is more than IFR0 size of 32KB then sectors from users flash can be associated for extended image size using CMPA.REC_IMG_EXT0/1.

bit_field_value.name: OEM_ROM_RWXL_CODE
bit_field_value.description: Not determined by ROM (MBC fields are modified by OEM code)

bit_field_value.name: OEM_ROOT_RWXL_1010
bit_field_value.description: Used as OEM Root of Trust image, in other words secondary boot loader (OEM_SBL). MBC protection bits set as RWXL = 1010. Updatable by OEM code later.

bit_field_value.name: OEM_SBL_RWXL_1011
bit_field_value.description: Used as OEM_SBL. MBC protection bits set as RWXL = 1011.

bit_field_value.name: OEM_SBL_RWXL_0011
bit_field_value.description: Used as OEM_SBL. MBC protection bits set as RWXL = 0011.

bit_field_value.name: OEM_REC_RWXL_1010
bit_field_value.description: Used as OEM recovery boot image with MBC protection RWXL = 1010 on ROM exiting to recovery image. But set to RWXL = 1010 on ROM exiting to user image.

bit_field_value.name: OEM_REC_RWXL_1011
bit_field_value.description: Used as OEM_RCVRY_IMG with MBC protection RWXL = 1010 on ROM exiting to recovery image. But set to RWXL = 1011 on ROM exiting to user image.

bit_field_value.name: OEM_REC_RWXL_0011
bit_field_value.description: Used as OEM_RCVRY_IMG with MBC protection RWXL = 1010 on ROM exiting to recovery image. But set to RWXL = 0011 on ROM exiting to user image.

bit_field_value.name: OEM_REC_RWXL_0001
bit_field_value.description: Used as OEM_RCVRY_IMG with MBC protection RWXL = 1010 on ROM exiting to recovery image. But set to RWXL = 0001 on ROM exiting to user image.

bit_field.name: ISP_PIN_ENTRY
bit_field.description: Disable ISP mode entry through pin assertion.

bit_field.name: ISP_DM_ENTRY
bit_field.description: Disable ISP mode entry through debug mailbox command.

bit_field.name: ISP_API_ENTRY
bit_field.description:
Disable ISP mode entry through ROM API call. 
ISP mode can be entered through ROM API invocation

bit_field.name: ISP_FT_ENTRY
bit_field.description: Disable ISP mode entry through image authentication failure

bit_field.name: REC_BOOT_LED
bit_field.description:
Assert on recovery boot. 
ROM drives the GPIO pin high, identified by this field whenever primary boot fails and fall through to recovery boot source. 
[4:0] GPIO Pin number. P0_0 and P0_1 are not supported. 
[7:5] GPIO port number. Only 0 - 4 ports are allowed. 
If this feature is not use then set this field to 0x00.

bit_field.name: ISP_BOOT_LED
bit_field.description:
Assert on ISP fall through. 
ROM drives the GPIO pin high identified by this field whenever primary boot fails and execution falls through to ISP mode. 
[[4:0] GPIO Pin number. P0_0 and P0_1 are not supported. 
[7:5] GPIO port number. Only 0 - 4 ports are allowed. 
If this feature is not use then set this field to 0x00.

bit_field.name: BOOT_FAIL_LED
bit_field.description:
Assert on fatal errors during boot. 
ROM drives the GPIO pin high identified by this field whenever primary boot fails due to fatal errors before locking-up/reset. 
[4:0] GPIO Pin number. P0_0 and P0_1 are not supported. 
[7:5] GPIO port number. Only 0 - 4 ports are allowed. 
If this feature is not use then set this field to 0x00.

bit_field.name: POWERDOWN_TIMEOUT_SECS
bit_field.description:
Power down timeout. 
ISP mode peripheral detection timeout value in seconds. 
If a non-zero value is program and peripheral activity is not detected within the number of seconds specified here, then the device will go to power down mode to conserve power.

bit_field.name: WDOG_TIMEOUT_COUNT
bit_field.description:
WDOG timeout. 
Upper 16 bits of 24-bit count value in WWDT0_TC register Timeout value in seconds. The lower 8 bits of WWDT0_TC are set to 0. 
When a non-zero value is programmed in this field ROM configures the watch dog timer to reset the device on timeout before passing execution control to user code.

bit_field.name: REC_SPI_SCK_PIN
bit_field.description:
Override default SPI_SCK ISP pin. 
Identifies the pin to be used as SPI_SCK pin. 
[4:0] GPIO Pin number 
[7:5] GPIO port number

bit_field.name: REC_SPI_SCK_FUNC_SLOT
bit_field.description: Identifies the ALT pin mux function to use for the pin selected by REC_SPI_SCK_PIN.

bit_field.name: REC_SPI_FLEXCOM
bit_field.description: Identifies the FlexComm used for SPI ISP mode.

bit_field.name: REC_SPI_MOSI_PIN
bit_field.description:
Override default SPI_MOSI ISP pin. 
Identifies the pin to be used as SPI_MOSI pin. 
[4:0] GPIO Pin number 
[7:5] GPIO port number

bit_field.name: REC_SPI_MOSI_FUNC_SLOT
bit_field.description: Identifies the ALT pin mux function to use for the pin selected by REC_SPI_MOSI_PIN.

bit_field.name: REC_SPI_MISO_PIN
bit_field.description:
Override default SPI_MISO ISP pin. 
Identifies the pin to be used as SPI_MISO pin. 
[4:0] GPIO Pin number 
[7:5] GPIO port number

bit_field.name: REC_SPI_MISO_FUNC_SLOT
bit_field.description: Identifies the ALT pin mux function to use for the pin selected by REC_SPI_MISO_PIN.

bit_field.name: REC_SPI_SSEL_PIN
bit_field.description:
Override default SPI_SSEL ISP pin. 
Identifies the pin to be used as SPI_SSEL pin. 
[4:0] GPIO Pin number 
[7:5] GPIO port number

bit_field.name: REC_SPI_SSEL_FUNC_SLOT
bit_field.description: Identifies the ALT pin mux function to use for the pin selected by REC_SPI_SSEL_PIN.

bit_field.name: REC_SPI_SSEL_X
bit_field.description:
SPI chip select number. 
FlexComm SPI interfaces supports up to four chip selects.

bit_field.name: REC_BOOT_PIN_CUST
bit_field.description: Use customer defined pins for 1-bit SPI recovery boot pins.

bit_field.name: UART_RX_PIN
bit_field.description:
Override default UART RX ISP pin. 
Identifies the pin to be used as UART_RX pin. 
[4:0] GPIO Pin number 
[7:5] GPIO port number

bit_field.name: UART_RX_FUNC_SLOT
bit_field.description: Identifies the ALT pin mux function to use for the pin selected by UART_RX_PIN.

bit_field.name: UART_ISP_FLEXCOM
bit_field.description: Identifies the FlexComm used for UART ISP mode.

bit_field.name: UART_TX_PIN
bit_field.description:
Override default UART TX ISP pin. 
Identifies the pin to be used as UART_TX pin. 
[4:0] GPIO Pin number 
[7:5] GPIO port number

bit_field.name: UART_TX_FUNC_SLOT
bit_field.description: Identifies the ALT pin mux function to use for the pin selected by UART_TX_PIN.

bit_field.name: I2C_SCL_PIN
bit_field.description:
Override default I2C SCL ISP pin. 
Identifies the pin to be used as I2C_SCL pin. 
[4:0] GPIO Pin number 
[7:5] GPIO port number

bit_field.name: I2C_SCL_FUNC_SLOT
bit_field.description: Identifies the ALT pin mux function to use for the pin selected by I2C_SCL_PIN.

bit_field.name: I2C_ISP_FLEXCOM
bit_field.description: Identifies the FlexComm used for I2C ISP mode.

bit_field.name: I2C_SDA_PIN
bit_field.description:
Override default I2C SDA ISP pin. 
Identifies the pin to be used as I2C_SDA pin. 
[4:0] GPIO Pin number 
[7:5] GPIO port number

bit_field.name: I2C_SDA_FUNC_SLOT
bit_field.description: Identifies the ALT pin mux function to use for the pin selected by I2C_SDA_PIN.

bit_field.name: CAN_RX_PIN
bit_field.description:
Override default CAN RX ISP pin. 
Identifies the pin to be used as CAN_RX pin. 
[4:0] GPIO Pin number 
[7:5] GPIO port number

bit_field.name: CAN_RX_FUNC_SLOT
bit_field.description: Identifies the ALT pin mux function to use for the pin selected by CAN_RX_PIN.

bit_field.name: CAN_ISP_INST
bit_field.description:
Identifies the instance used for CAN ISP mode. 
0: For CAN0. 
1: For CAN1. 
Others: Reserved.

bit_field.name: CAN_TX_PIN
bit_field.description:
Override default CAN TX ISP pin. 
Identifies the pin to be used as CAN_TX pin. 
[7:5] GPIO port number 
[4:0] GPIO Pin number

bit_field.name: CAN_TX_FUNC_SLOT
bit_field.description: Identifies the ALT pin mux function to use for the pin selected by CAN_TX_PIN.

bit_field.name: CAN_BAUD_RATE
bit_field.description:
CAN baud rate. 
Baud rate configured during CAN ISP mode. 
2b'0000: Auto baud detection (125K, 250K, 500K, 750K, 1M). 
2b'0101 and above: 1000 kbps and auto baud detection.

bit_field.name: SPI_SCK_PIN
bit_field.description:
Override default SPI_SCK ISP pin. 
Identifies the pin to be used as SPI_SCK pin. 
[4:0] GPIO Pin number 
[7:5] GPIO port number

bit_field.name: SPI_SCK_FUNC_SLOT
bit_field.description: Identifies the ALT pin mux function to use for the pin selected by SPI_SCK_PIN.

bit_field.name: SPI_ISP_FLEXCOM
bit_field.description: Identifies the FlexComm used for SPI ISP mode.

bit_field.name: SPI_MOSI_PIN
bit_field.description:
Override default SPI_MOSI ISP pin. 
Identifies the pin to be used as SPI_MOSI pin. 
[4:0] GPIO Pin number 
[7:5] GPIO port number

bit_field.name: SPI_MOSI_FUNC_SLOT
bit_field.description: Identifies the ALT pin mux function to use for the pin selected by SPI_MOSI_PIN.

bit_field.name: SPI_MISO_PIN
bit_field.description:
Override default SPI_MISO ISP pin. 
Identifies the pin to be used as SPI_MISO pin. 
[4:0] GPIO Pin number 
[7:5] GPIO port number

bit_field.name: SPI_MISO_FUNC_SLOT
bit_field.description: Identifies the ALT pin mux function to use for the pin selected by SPI_MISO_PIN.

bit_field.name: SPI_SSEL_PIN
bit_field.description:
Override default SPI_SSEL ISP pin. 
Identifies the pin to be used as SPI_SSEL pin. 
[4:0] GPIO Pin number 
[7:5] GPIO port number

bit_field.name: SPI_SSEL_FUNC_SLOT
bit_field.description: Identifies the ALT pin mux function to use for the pin selected by SPI_SSEL_PIN.

bit_field.name: ISP_SPI_SSEL_X
bit_field.description:
SPI chip select number. 
FlexComm SPI interfaces supports up to four chip selects.

bit_field.name: USB_Vendor_ID
bit_field.description: Customer defined USB vendor ID used during USB-ISP mode device enumeration.

bit_field.name: USB_Product_ID
bit_field.description: Customer defined USB product ID used during USB-ISP mode device enumeration.

bit_field.name: USBx_VBUS_PIN
bit_field.description:
Override default USBx_VBUS_DETECT ISP pin. 
Identifies the pin to be used as USBx_VBUS detect pin. 
[4:0] GPIO Pin number 
[7:5] GPIO port number

bit_field.name: USBx_VBUS_FUNC_SLOT
bit_field.description: Identifies the ALT pin mux function to use for the pin selected by USBx_VBUS_PIN.

bit_field.name: EXT_XTAL_CLK
bit_field.description:
USB PHY input clock frequency. 
For USB high speed PHY external XTAL input is needed. This field specifies the frequency of XTAL used on board.

bit_field_value.name: XTAL_16MHZ
bit_field_value.description: 16MHz input clock (Divide by 30) - Default option when CMPA is blank.

bit_field.name: PRE_DIV
bit_field.description:
Enable Pre-divider. 
Needed to support 48MHz and other high speed crystals.

bit_field.name: I2C_SLAVE_ADDR
bit_field.description:
I2C slave address. 
A 7-bit Address used for selecting our device on shared I2C bus system. 
By default ROM uses 0x10 as slave address. If this address conflicts with another slave on board customer could use this field to override the address.

bit_field.name: ISP_USB_CUST
bit_field.description: Use customer defined GPIO for USB VBUS detect function during ISP mode.

bit_field_value.name: USB0_VBUS
bit_field_value.description: Customer defined GPIO for USB0_VBUS detect.

bit_field_value.name: USB1_VBUS
bit_field_value.description: Customer defined GPIO for USB1_VBUS detect.

bit_field_value.name: VDD_USB
bit_field_value.description: Use VDD_USB for VBUS presence. On board regulator should generate VDD_USB voltage using 5V input fo VBUS pin on connector.

bit_field.name: ISP_CAN_CUST
bit_field.description: Use customer defined CAN ISP pins.

bit_field.name: ISP_SPI_CUST
bit_field.description: Use customer defined SPI ISP pins.

bit_field.name: ISP_I2C_CUST
bit_field.description: Use customer defined I2C ISP pins.

bit_field.name: ISP_UART_CUST
bit_field.description: Use customer defined UART ISP pins.

register.name: DCFG_CC_SOCU_PIN
register.description: Credential Constraints for SoC specific Use Pinned

bit_field.name: NIDEN
bit_field.description: Non-secure Non-invasive Debug Enable

bit_field.name: DBGEN
bit_field.description: Non-secure Debug Enable

bit_field.name: SPNIDEN
bit_field.description: Secure Non-invasive Debug Enable

bit_field.name: SPIDEN
bit_field.description: Secure Invasive Debug Enable

bit_field.name: ISP_CMD_EN
bit_field.description: ISP Boot Command Enable

bit_field.name: FA_CMD_EN
bit_field.description: FA Command Enable

bit_field.name: ME_CMD_EN
bit_field.description: Flash Mass Erase Command Enable

bit_field.name: UUID_CHECK
bit_field.description: Enforce UUID match during Debug authentication.

bit_field_value.name: DISABLED
bit_field_value.description: Debug certificate can be used with all devices.

bit_field_value.name: ENABLED
bit_field_value.description: Debug certificate per device with matching UUID is needed.

bit_field.name: INVERSE_VALUE
bit_field.description: Inverse Value

register.name: DCFG_CC_SOCU_DFLT
register.description: Credential Constraints for SoC specific Use Debug Filter

bit_field.name: NIDEN
bit_field.description: Non Secure Non-invasive Debug Fixed State

bit_field.name: DBGEN
bit_field.description: Non-secure Debug Fixed State

bit_field.name: SPNIDEN
bit_field.description: Secure Non-invasive Debug Fixed State

bit_field.name: SPIDEN
bit_field.description: Secure Invasive Debug Fixed State

bit_field.name: ISP_CMD_EN
bit_field.description: ISP Command Fixed State

bit_field.name: FA_CMD_EN
bit_field.description: FA Command Fixed State

bit_field.name: ME_CMD_EN
bit_field.description: Flash Mass Erase Command Fixed State

bit_field.name: INVERSE_VALUE
bit_field.description: Inverse Value

bit_field.name: VENDOR_USAGE
bit_field.description:
Vendor Usage [31:16]. 
Upper 16 bits of vendor usage field defined in DAP. Lower 16-bits come from customer field area (CFPA.DBG_REVOKE_VU).

bit_field.name: SEC_BOOT_EN
bit_field.description:
Secure boot enforcement. 
This field defines the minimum image verification procedure (CRC32, CMAC, ECDSA sign). 
The Image type field in header indicates the type of verification data (checksum or signature) included in it. 
Note: Plain < CRC32 < CMAC < ECDSA

bit_field_value.name: CRC32_IMAGES
bit_field_value.description: Only CRC32 or signed (CMAC or ECDSA) images are allowed.

bit_field_value.name: SIGNED_IMAGES
bit_field_value.description: Only Signed (CMAC or ECDSA) images are allowed.

bit_field_value.name: ECDSA_SIGNED
bit_field_value.description: Only ECDSA signed images are allowed.

bit_field.name: LP_SEC_BOOT
bit_field.description: Secure boot option for low-power wake from power-down and deep-powerdown. For CFPA/CMPA do CRC check always.

bit_field_value.name: CHECK_CRC32
bit_field_value.description: CRC check for PFR and CRC32 check of active image

bit_field_value.name: CHECK_JUMP
bit_field_value.description: CRC check for PFR and jump to vector address specified in CFPA.

bit_field_value.name: CMAC_CHECK
bit_field_value.description: CRC check for PFR and CMAC check of active image

bit_field.name: ENF_CNSA
bit_field.description:
Enforce CNSA suite approved algorithms for secure boot, secure update and debug authentication. 
Note, CMAC image authentication is only allowed in 2b'00 setting.

bit_field_value.name: LIMITED_0b01
bit_field_value.description: Only ECC P-384 keys, SHA384 and AES256 algorithms are used.

bit_field_value.name: LIMITED_0b10
bit_field_value.description: Only ECC P-384 keys, SHA384 and AES256 algorithms are used.

bit_field_value.name: LIMITED_0b11
bit_field_value.description: Only ECC P-384 keys, SHA384 and AES256 algorithms are used.

bit_field.name: ENF_TZM_PRESET
bit_field.description: Enforce TrustZone-M mode.

bit_field_value.name: ENFORCE_0b01
bit_field_value.description: Enforce preset TZM data in image manifest.

bit_field_value.name: ENFORCE_0b10
bit_field_value.description: Enforce preset TZM data in image manifest.

bit_field_value.name: ENFORCE_0b11
bit_field_value.description: Enforce preset TZM data in image manifest.

bit_field.name: ITRC_ZEROIZE
bit_field.description:
RAM zeroize on ITRC event. 
Zeroize long-term storage RAM (RAMA) on subsequent boot when Intrusion and Tamper control signals an intrusion event (ITRC_OUT3). 
Note, when ITRC is re-configured in application then ITRC_OUT4 (CHIP_RESET) should be triggered with at least same events as ITRC_OUT3 (RAM_ZEROIZE).

bit_field_value.name: PKC_RAM_ON_ITRC
bit_field_value.description: Always Zeroize PKC RAM on ITRC event only.

bit_field_value.name: PKC_RAMA_ON_ITRC
bit_field_value.description: Zeroize PKC and RAMA on ITRC event only.

bit_field_value.name: PKC_RAMA_ALL_RESET
bit_field_value.description: Always Zeroize PKC and RAMA on all reset boot.

bit_field.name: ACTIVE_IMG_PROT
bit_field.description:
Protection of active image. 
This field defines protection of flash area occupied by the active image. Only applicable to internal flash.

bit_field_value.name: FLASH_ACL_PROTECTION
bit_field_value.description: Protection is defined using the CFPA FLASH_ACL settings.

bit_field_value.name: WITH_STICKY_LOCK
bit_field_value.description: Write protect active image area with sticky lock. GLBAC2 is used. FLASH_ACL settings are ignored.

bit_field_value.name: NO_STICKY_LOCK
bit_field_value.description: Write protect active image area without sticky lock. GLBAC4 is used. FLASH_ACL settings are ignored.

bit_field_value.name: XOM_PROTECTION
bit_field_value.description: XOM protect active image area with sticky lock. GLBAC6 is used. FLASH_ACL settings are ignored.

bit_field.name: FIPS_SHA_STEN
bit_field.description: Enable self-test for SHA2 block on power-up. Needed for FIPS certification. If this field is non-zero run self-test and log result in SYSCON->ELS_AS_BOOT_LOG1[FIPS].

bit_field_value.name: FAILURE_ISP
bit_field_value.description: On failure enter ISP mode for recovery.

bit_field_value.name: FAILURE_ENF_POWER_CYC
bit_field_value.description: On failure lock the device to enforce power-cycle.

bit_field.name: FIPS_AES_STEN
bit_field.description: Enable self-test for AES block on power-up. Needed for FIPS certification. If this field is non-zero run self-test and log result in SYSCON->ELS_AS_BOOT_LOG1[FIPS].

bit_field_value.name: FAILURE_ISP
bit_field_value.description: On failure enter ISP mode for recovery.

bit_field_value.name: FAILURE_ENF_POWER_CYC
bit_field_value.description: On failure lock the device to enforce power-cycle.

bit_field.name: FIPS_ECDSA_STEN
bit_field.description: Enable self-test for ECDSA block on power-up. Needed for FIPS certification. If this field is non-zero run self-test and log result in SYSCON->ELS_AS_BOOT_LOG1[FIPS].

bit_field_value.name: FAILURE_ISP
bit_field_value.description: On failure enter ISP mode for recovery.

bit_field_value.name: FAILURE_ENF_POWER_CYC
bit_field_value.description: On failure lock the device to enforce power-cycle.

bit_field.name: FIPS_DRBG_STEN
bit_field.description: Enable self-test for DRBG block on power-up. Needed for FIPS certification. If this field is non-zero run self-test and log result in SYSCON->ELS_AS_BOOT_LOG1[FIPS].

bit_field_value.name: FAILURE_ISP
bit_field_value.description: On failure enter ISP mode for recovery.

bit_field_value.name: FAILURE_ENF_POWER_CYC
bit_field_value.description: On failure lock the device to enforce power-cycle.

bit_field.name: FIPS_CMAC_STEN
bit_field.description: Enable self-test for CMAC block on power-up. Needed for FIPS certification. If this field is non-zero run self-test and log result in SYSCON->ELS_AS_BOOT_LOG1[FIPS].

bit_field_value.name: FAILURE_ISP
bit_field_value.description: On failure enter ISP mode for recovery.

bit_field_value.name: FAILURE_ENF_POWER_CYC
bit_field_value.description: On failure lock the device to enforce power-cycle.

bit_field.name: FIPS_KDF_STEN
bit_field.description: Enable self-test for KDF block on power-up. Needed for FIPS certification. If this field is non-zero run self-test and log result in SYSCON->ELS_AS_BOOT_LOG1[FIPS].

bit_field_value.name: FAILURE_ISP
bit_field_value.description: On failure enter ISP mode for recovery.

bit_field_value.name: FAILURE_ENF_POWER_CYC
bit_field_value.description: On failure lock the device to enforce power-cycle.

bit_field.name: FIPS_PUF_STEN
bit_field.description: Enable self-test for PUF block on power-up. Needed for FIPS certification. If this field is non-zero run self-test and log result in SYSCON->ELS_AS_BOOT_LOG1[FIPS].

bit_field_value.name: FAILURE_ISP
bit_field_value.description: On failure enter ISP mode for recovery.

bit_field_value.name: FAILURE_ENF_POWER_CYC
bit_field_value.description: On failure lock the device to enforce power-cycle.

bit_field.name: RoTK0_Usage
bit_field.description: RoT key 0 usage properties.

bit_field_value.name: USABLE
bit_field_value.description: Usable as debug CA, image CA, FW CA, image and FW key.

bit_field_value.name: IMG_BOOT_FW
bit_field_value.description: Usable as image (boot and FW) CA only.

bit_field_value.name: DEBUG_BOOT_FW_IMG
bit_field_value.description: Usable as debug, boot and FW image CA.

bit_field_value.name: IMG_FW_UPDATE_KEY
bit_field_value.description: Usable as image key and FW update key only.

bit_field_value.name: BOOT_IMAGE_KEY
bit_field_value.description: Usable as boot image key only.

bit_field_value.name: FW_UPDATE_IMG_KEY
bit_field_value.description: Usable as FW update image key only.

bit_field.name: RoTK1_Usage
bit_field.description: RoT key 1 usage properties.

bit_field_value.name: USABLE
bit_field_value.description: Usable as debug CA, image CA, FW CA, image and FW key.

bit_field_value.name: IMG_BOOT_FW
bit_field_value.description: Usable as image (boot and FW) CA only.

bit_field_value.name: DEBUG_BOOT_FW_IMG
bit_field_value.description: Usable as debug, boot and FW image CA.

bit_field_value.name: IMG_FW_UPDATE_KEY
bit_field_value.description: Usable as image key and FW update key only.

bit_field_value.name: BOOT_IMAGE_KEY
bit_field_value.description: Usable as boot image key only.

bit_field_value.name: FW_UPDATE_IMG_KEY
bit_field_value.description: Usable as FW update image key only.

bit_field.name: RoTK2_Usage
bit_field.description: RoT key 2 usage properties.

bit_field_value.name: USABLE
bit_field_value.description: Usable as debug CA, image CA, FW CA, image and FW key.

bit_field_value.name: IMG_BOOT_FW
bit_field_value.description: Usable as image (boot and FW) CA only.

bit_field_value.name: DEBUG_BOOT_FW_IMG
bit_field_value.description: Usable as debug, boot and FW image CA.

bit_field_value.name: IMG_FW_UPDATE_KEY
bit_field_value.description: Usable as image key and FW update key only.

bit_field_value.name: BOOT_IMAGE_KEY
bit_field_value.description: Usable as boot image key only.

bit_field_value.name: FW_UPDATE_IMG_KEY
bit_field_value.description: Usable as FW update image key only.

bit_field.name: RoTK3_Usage
bit_field.description: RoT key 3 usage properties.

bit_field_value.name: USABLE
bit_field_value.description: Usable as debug CA, image CA, FW CA, image and FW key.

bit_field_value.name: IMG_BOOT_FW
bit_field_value.description: Usable as image (boot and FW) CA only.

bit_field_value.name: DEBUG_BOOT_FW_IMG
bit_field_value.description: Usable as debug, boot and FW image CA.

bit_field_value.name: IMG_FW_UPDATE_KEY
bit_field_value.description: Usable as image key and FW update key only.

bit_field_value.name: BOOT_IMAGE_KEY
bit_field_value.description: Usable as boot image key only.

bit_field_value.name: FW_UPDATE_IMG_KEY
bit_field_value.description: Usable as FW update image key only.

bit_field.name: SKIP_DICE
bit_field.description: Skip DICE computation.

bit_field.name: DICE_INC_NXP_CFG
bit_field.description: Include NXP area (IFR1) containing specific part configuration data defined during chip manufacturing process in DICE computation.

bit_field.name: DICE_INC_CUST_CFG
bit_field.description: Include data from CMPA page (512 bytes) in DICE computation.

bit_field.name: REG0_ERASE_CHECK_EN
bit_field.description:
Enable erase check for NPX PRINCE context 0. 
When erase check is enabled ROM API will enforce a check to guarantee that all sectors selected in the context are erased together. 
When erase check is enabled only contiguous sectors can be selected in context bitmap. 
 0x - ROM API will not perform erase check. 
 1x - ROM API will perform erase check.

bit_field.name: REG1_ERASE_CHECK_EN
bit_field.description:
Enable erase check for NPX PRINCE context 1. 
When erase check is enabled ROM API will enforce a check to guarantee that all sectors selected in the context are erased together. 
When erase check is enabled only contiguous sectors can be selected in context bitmap. 
 0x - ROM API will not perform erase check. 
 1x - ROM API will perform erase check.

bit_field.name: REG2_ERASE_CHECK_EN
bit_field.description:
Enable erase check for NPX PRINCE context 2. 
When erase check is enabled ROM API will enforce a check to guarantee that all sectors selected in the context are erased together. 
When erase check is enabled only contiguous sectors can be selected in context bitmap. 
 0x - ROM API will not perform erase check. 
 1x - ROM API will perform erase check.

bit_field.name: REG3_ERASE_CHECK_EN
bit_field.description:
Enable erase check for NPX PRINCE context 3. 
When erase check is enabled ROM API will enforce a check to guarantee that all sectors selected in the context are erased together. 
When erase check is enabled only contiguous sectors can be selected in context bitmap. 
 0x - ROM API will not perform erase check. 
 1x - ROM API will perform erase check.

bit_field.name: NPX_LOCK_CTX0
bit_field.description:
Lock on-chip flash NPX PRINCE context 0 settings. 
Note: when locking a region recommendation is to also enable erase checking using the REG0_ERASE_CHECK_EN field.

bit_field.name: NPX_LOCK_CTX1
bit_field.description:
Lock on-chip flash NPX PRINCE context 1 settings. 
Note: when locking a region recommendation is to also enable erase checking using the REG1_ERASE_CHECK_EN field.

bit_field.name: NPX_LOCK_CTX2
bit_field.description:
Lock on-chip flash NPX PRINCE context 2 settings. 
Note: when locking a region recommendation is to also enable erase checking using the REG2_ERASE_CHECK_EN field.

bit_field.name: NPX_LOCK_CTX3
bit_field.description:
Lock on-chip flash NPX PRINCE context 3 settings. 
Note: when locking a region recommendation is to also enable erase checking using the REG3_ERASE_CHECK_EN field.

register.name: NPX_CTX0_WD0
register.description: Bitmap mask for NPX Prince context 0 (sectors 0 -31)

register.name: NPX_CTX1_WD0
register.description: Bitmap mask for NPX Prince context 1 (sectors 0 -31)

register.name: NPX_CTX2_WD0
register.description: Bitmap mask for NPX Prince context 2 (sectors 0 -31)

register.name: NPX_CTX3_WD0
register.description: Bitmap mask for NPX Prince context 3 (sectors 0 -31)

register.name: REC_IMG_EXT0
register.description: Bitmap mask for recovery image extended sectors (sectors 8 - 31).

bit_field.name: REC_IMG_EXT0
bit_field.description:
Bitmap mask to indicate sectors included in recovery image. Recovery image is programmed in BANK1_IFR0. But if the image size is more than 32KB, this field can be used to indicate sectors to include in recovery image. 
ROM will configure flash protection setting for these sectors the same as BANK1_IFR0 before exiting to user code. 
The protection settings are managed through CMPA.OEM_BANK1_IFR0_PROT. The lower 8 sectors are excluded from this mask to avoid conflicts with dual image boot feature.

register.name: QUICK_SET_GPIO_0
register.description:
Drive GPIO 0 port [31:0] pins high after reset. 
Each bit corresponds to the pin in GPIO port 0. When set ROM drives the corresponding pin high as soon as possible. By default most pins come-up as tri-stated inputs. 
This feature allows customer to specify active drive pins soon after reset instead of waiting till complete boot. 
Note, if a pin is selected in both QUICK_SET_GPIO_0 and QUICK_CLR_GPIO_0 fields then pin will be set to high-level with quick transition to low.

register.name: QUICK_CLR_GPIO_0
register.description:
Drive GPIO 0 port [31:0] pins low. 
Each bit corresponds to the pin in GPIO port 0. When set ROM drives the corresponding pin high as soon as possible. By default most pins come-up as tri-stated inputs. 
This feature allows customer to specify active drive pins soon after reset instead of waiting till complete boot. 
Note, if a pin is selected in both QUICK_SET_GPIO_0 and QUICK_CLR_GPIO_0 fields then pin will be set to high-level with quick transition to low.

register.name: CMPA_CRC32
register.description: CRC32 of CMPA page data from offset 0x00 to 0x1EB. ROM updates this field along with CMPA_CMAC. ROM uses this field based on CMPA.LP_SEC_BOOT field option.

bit_field.name: FIELD
bit_field.description: CMPA_CRC32 for address range 0x0100_4000 - 0x0100_41EB

register.name: CMPA_CMAC0
register.description: CMAC[31:0] of CMPA page data from offset 0x00 to 0x1EB. ROM updates this field on subsequent boot after page update.

register.name: CMPA_CMAC1
register.description: CMAC[63:32] of CMPA page data from offset 0x00 to 0x1EB. ROM updates this field on subsequent boot after page update.

register.name: CMPA_CMAC2
register.description: CMAC[95:64] of CMPA page data from offset 0x00 to 0x1EB. ROM updates this field on subsequent boot after page update.

register.name: CMPA_CMAC3
register.description: CMAC[127:96] of CMPA page data from offset 0x00 to 0x1EB. ROM updates this field on subsequent boot after page update.
